Author: nuuma

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

The Universal Rom-Com Allocation System has finally found him and deemed him worthy.He’s going to be the best Fake Boyfriend this beautiful man has ever seen. Or, Eddie needs a fake boyfriend. Buck is about to deliver the Oscar-worthy performance of a lifetime.

entry.title: 9-1-1 What's Your Emergency?
entry.summary:
Author: Duckkey

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,742Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 2

Summary: When Buck moved to LA he was following a true purpose: He was going to be a firefighter for the LAFD. He put in the work, the studying the training, all to have that dream ripped away from him a month before graduating the academy. Buck needed to adjust his path finding himself working as a 9-1-1 Emergency Dispatcher in attempt to answer the calling that brought him to LA.Buck still manages to find family with the 118.~When Bobby asked what made him decide on firefighting Buck attempted to doge the question, "You're gonna laugh.""Try me," Bobby shrugged."I saw a movie," Buck answered. Bobby snorted."I told you."Bobby smiled, "You just seem the type. You see a cool stunt on TV?"Buck resisted the urge to sneer a bit while he defended himself, "No. Well, I mean. Okay, yeah, the stunts were cool but I really liked the brotherhood, you know?"Bobby lifted an eyebrow. Buck corrected, "Or, siblinghood, whatever. The team. Having people have my back, it was a nice thought."Bobby hummed, "You're really caught up on this whole team stuff, huh?"Buck flashed a teasing grin, "So just my luck I get a loner mentor."

entry.title: Lighthouse
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 204,744Chapters: 35/35Kudos: 1,377

Summary: Buck had lost-- he was sure of this now. His resolve only lasted a few weeks before his exterior began to crack; he was never a very good actor. He couldn’t keep up the greetings and the asking questions and the easy stroll. He let his shoulders creep up to his ears, let his foot tap incessantly. He did what his Captain told him, but stopped asking for anything more. Stopped following the conversation in the back of the engine on the way to the call; he just stared out the window, thinking about the case to come, preparing for it. When he woke every morning, there was no big recovery milestone to strive for, no big fight for the soul of his career to win. Not even the happy swell of being back on shift -- something so easy to dismiss, that had dominated so much of his life, that he had taken for granted-- that had catalyzed him each morning of his first week back.An old habit of his had returned. A bad habit.~~or: after the lawsuit, buck confronts what it was he wanted all along. he looks and looks and longs for it; the team looks right through him. buck breaks-- right down the middle.

entry.title: Between comfort and chaos
entry.summary:
Author: sobittersweet

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 80,658Chapters: 35/35Kudos: 22

Summary: The fire is still growing. The beams are groaning. Time is running out.Eddie’s heart clenches.“They’re not coming, Buck. You need to go.”Not because he wants to let go. But because he can’t bear the thought of Buck dying here too.He’s already risking everything by staying.And Eddie—Eddie doesn’t want the last thing he sees to be Buck falling beside him.“NO.” Buck snaps. “I told you. We’re surviving this together.”He starts yelling, voice ripping through the air.“HELP!” He coughs. “Bobby! Hen! HELP!!”The desperation in Buck’s voice slices through Eddie’s chest more than the crushing weight above him ever could. He wants to stop him, to tell him not to waste his breath, but he can’t. Because some part of him—some foolish, aching part—still hopes too.-or-One call changes everything. After nearly losing each other, Buck and Eddie are forced to face the feelings they’ve spent years burying. But grief, guilt, and fear don’t make falling in love any easier. It’s messy. It’s slow. And it might already be too late.

entry.title: Stormy Nights
entry.summary:
Author: kristi (aurehose)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,710Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 16

Summary: “Nooo! No no no no no—” he wailed, rocking slightly, his voice smaller than it should’ve been coming from Buck’s full-grown body. Eddie knelt in front of him, reaching out carefully, hands slow and steady. “I’m here, cariño,” he whispered. “I’ve got you. It’s just a storm, baby. It’s just noise. I’ve got you.”

entry.title: you’ve got opinions, man
entry.summary:
Author: oneofthesirens

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,740Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 549

Summary: “I am so unbelievably sorry. I swear I’m never late, I just got caught up at work, and I couldn’t exactly leave an active fire for a date and — Oh.” Once he settles into the booth, Evan meets Eddie’s eyes across the table. Evan Buckley. As in Witness Number #1 at Eddie's disastrous first date. Maddie’s brother, Evan Buckley. Fuck Eddie’s entire life. “Diaz?” Evan says, looking a bit stupid with how wide his mouth hangs open. He looks over his shoulder like someone’s waiting to jump out and tell him this is a prank. Eddie envies his optimism. He’s long since accepted that the universe is actively out to get him. or: Eddie and Maddie go on a blind date, Eddie and Buck go on a blind date, Eddie and Buck go on a blind date (again). It’s complicated.

entry.title: Stay A Little Longer, Cowboy
entry.summary:
Author: inkandschaos

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,789Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 66

Summary: When Buck inherits a rundown patch of Texas land from an uncle he barely remembers, he figures he’ll sell it and get back to L.A. in time for the weekend surf. But the land comes with a stubborn gate, a small-town welcome committee that already thinks he’s married, and one very complicated cowboy named Eddie Diaz.Eddie’s got a ranch, a seven-year-old son who’s already attached, and a past he doesn’t like to talk about. Buck’s got a city-boy attitude, jeans that fit a little too well, and no clue how to fix a tractor. Or a fence. Or his feelings.

entry.title: Does He Know?
entry.summary:
Author: carpediaz

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,329Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 48

Summary: Lily wonders if Eddie does anything other than talk to Buck when he’s not with Chris, because everytime she runs into him (which is a lot because they’re currently living less than a mile from each other) he’s got Buck on a video call. They bicker about what colour Eddie should paint his kitchen - “Eddie, you wanna go with something warm to make it inviting,” Buck had insisted, cackling triumphantly when Lily had agreed with him. They reminisce about calls they attended - “okay but you have to admit that Ravi fucked that one up, right? I asked for gauze and he handed me an IV bag,” Buck had sneered, wholly offended by Eddie reminding him that Ravi had been terrified of him after the ‘chainsaw incident’.orThe one where one of Eddie's highschool friends witnesses Buck and Eddie on video calls over the span of a few weeks and wonders why the fuck they're not together

entry.title: This Place Could Be Beautiful, Right? You Could Make This Place Beautiful.
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,599Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 104

Summary: Life is no longer the same for Eddie and Buck. The last seven years of comfort and familiarity are threatened to be washed away and in its place now is a physical seperation by hundred of miles.But alas, they trudge on.Buck learns how to love himself amidst loneliness and how to let that be enough.Eddie grapples with his shifting identity and what it means to be unsure of yourself in a world that seems to be so unforgiving.Both men find love in one another and in their diverging lives. And even in the weeks and months to come, as they make their way back to one another, they realize that loving themselves is the only foundation their relationship can rest on.OR: Buck remains in LA with his lingering feelings in this new chapter of his life without Eddie by his side.Eddie is in Texas working on his relationship with Christopher.When you are a parent, you are trying to sell the world to your children.‘Any decent realtor, walking you through a shithole, chirps on about good bones.'And both Buck and Eddie realize that to love the world, they must first love who they are in it.

entry.title: What a touch of your hand can do
entry.summary:
Author: cathcer1984

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,209Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 142

Summary: It’s obvious that Eddie’s in the same clothes he was wearing when they went out last night, his shirt is buttoned askew, he knows there’s a hickey high on his neck. His eyes are bloodshot with dark circles underneath from too little sleep, his mouth is puffy. “Jeez Eddie,” Hen says as she peers at him. “What happened to you last night?” Chimney’s letting out a low wolf whistle before saying, "you mean who happened to you last night." Grinning sheepishly, Eddie mutters, “you should see the other guy,” as he dumps his bag on the bench and sinking down onto it. He doesn’t miss the look exchanged between Hen and Chim.

entry.title: If I Could Turn Back Time
entry.summary:
Author: Jackson_Slade

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 635Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Buck struggles under the weight of the fallout from the lawsuit. He knows he cannot continue the way he's going, that something has to change. When an opportunity to transfer comes up, he takes it and tries very hard not to look back.The 118 is having a hard time reconciling the actions Buck took to get back onto the team. When they come back in to an empty firehouse, they're confused. Where is Buck? Is he okay? Has something happened to him? They begin to question their actions and words to Buck, especially when Bobby finds a set of documents on his desk.Will the 118 learn from their mistakes? Will Eddie be able to forgive Buck, forgive himself? Will Buck and Eddie rekindle their relationship?Maybe they can find their forgiveness in the lyrics of songs sung at karaoke.

entry.title: Every Story Has A Beginning, Middle, And End But Not Necessarily In That Order
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,588Chapters: 3/15Kudos: 32

Summary: Sometimes love doesn’t knock—it quietly moves in, settles on the couch, makes coffee in the morning, and slips into your heart when you’re too busy dancing around it to notice.And every great story has a beginning, middle, and end. But not necessarily in that order. Nothing in Eddie Diaz’s or Evan Buckley’s life has happened linearly so far, but it has occurred nevertheless. And them falling in love with one another is not another exception.OR:There are better no roommates than Evan Buckley and Eddie Diaz, and there is no state more natural for the pair of best friends than living together under one roof.They have a routine, you see. One they had down before they even lived together, but now that they do, it's like second nature.Buck, Eddie, and Christopher have a long summer ahead of them living in one house. And it’s a season filled with:Kitchen mishaps and New RecipesBarbecues and Family LoveZoo visits and Science CampsHeat Waves and Ballroom DancingA love confession. Or Two?Stolen glances, Secret kisses in their dreamsDangerous Calls That Threaten To Put Everything In PerilAnd so, so much more...

entry.title: My bloody steps leave a trail (I beg you to follow)
entry.summary:
Author: That_humanpersonthing

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,135Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 42

Summary: What if Eddie wasn't ok after Chris left. What if his days started with a practiced smile, and scratches on his thighs so he could feel something other then the numbness. To make him feel something, after being left with nothing when his son walked out the door. What if Eddie saw no hope in getting what he wanted back, he made a plan.Or what if Eddie gives himself two weeks to ensure everything will be ok, and then he'll be gone.

entry.title: Soul Tied
entry.summary:
Author: Bucklleydiaz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,594Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 364

Summary: After a fight leaves things tense between them, Buck and Eddie head out on what should’ve been a routine call but it goes terribly wrong.In the aftermath of it, Eddie is left to navigate the wreckage: guilt, silence, and the growing sense that something is deeply wrong.The team is distant. The truth is fractured. And somewhere beneath it all, a love neither of them dared name begins to haunt what’s been left behind.OrA love is confessed. A shot is fired. And everything falls apart.

entry.title: If You Fall Asleep Down By The Water
entry.summary:
Author: fruitsdoesnotknow

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,360Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 66

Summary: Look, Ravi’s heard everything there is to hear, okay? A shift is… something. When he first joined the 118, it was told to him like a joke, like a curse. "Oh, be careful if you get assigned A shift! You’ll get rebar through the head, or trapped down a well! Haha!" Well. It wasn’t really a joke to Ravi, not really. Not now. Not when he got close to the team, when they went from strangers to colleagues to just… more. When it became looking at baby pictures and talking about college funds and asking about how his parents are doing and if they’re still planning to come visit for his birthday and – Yeah. Ravi's glad he got mixed up in this weird little group. But the curse, well. The others weren’t exactly wrong about that part. And maybe Ravi was a little naïve to think it wouldn’t catch up to him eventually, sure. But – “Ravi!” Bobby yelled, as Ravi gets punched in the face. ***Ravi gains a concussion, a bunch of blankets, and a reminder about his place in the 118.
